rev.diff:
Line 435: Line 435:
===Israeli border===
===Israeli border===
{{main|2011 Israeli border demonstrations}}
{{main|2011 Israeli border demonstrations}}
  +
[[File:Free Palestine rally in Cairo.jpg|thumb|Free Palestine rally in [[Cairo]]]]
  +
Inspired by the uprisings and revolutions taking place in the Arab world, Palestinians used [[Facebook]] to call for mass protests throughout the region on 15 May 2011, Nakba Day.<ref name=ATimes>[http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Middle_East/ME18Ak03.html Persistence will pay off for Palestinians]</ref><ref name=YNETr>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4069686,00.html Syrian infiltrator recounts journey to TA]</ref> A page calling for a "Third Palestinian Intifada" to begin on 15 May garnered more than 350,000 "likes" before being taken down by Facebook managers at the end of March after complaints from the Israeli government that the page encouraged violence.<ref name=Philips>[http://www.thirdage.com/news/israeli-troops-clash-with-palestinian-protesters_05-15-2011?page=2 Israeli Troops Clash with Palestinian Protesters]</ref> {{Verify credibility|date=June 2011}} <ref name=CNN3>[http://articles.cnn.com/2011-03-29/world/palestinian.facebook_1_facebook-page-social-media-website-incites-violence?_s=PM:WORLD Facebook page supporting Palestinian intifada pulled down]</ref> The page called for mass marches to Palestine from Egypt, Lebanon, Syria and Jordan to commemorate the Nakba and demand the [[Palestinian right of return|right of return]] for all Palestinian refugees.<ref name=AhramO>[http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/11737/Egypt/Politics-/Egyptians-call-for-a-march-to-Palestine-on-Nakba-d.aspx Egyptians to mark Nakba with a march to Palestine]</ref> Palestinians from Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Syria, the Gaza Strip and the West Bank attempted to reach and cross the Israeli border. However, they were all stopped and 12 were shot and killed by Israeli security forces. Almost 300 people were injured, including 13 Israeli soldiers. There were also clashes across the annexed east Jerusalem.<ref>[http://www.france24.com/en/20110516-bloodshed-along-israel-borders-kills-12-nakba-day-0# Bloodshed along Israel borders kills 12 on Nakba Day]</ref>
Inspired by the uprisings and revolutions taking place in the Arab world, Palestinians used [[Facebook]] to call for mass protests throughout the region on 15 May 2011, Nakba Day.<ref name=ATimes>[http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Middle_East/ME18Ak03.html Persistence will pay off for Palestinians]</ref><ref name=YNETr>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4069686,00.html Syrian infiltrator recounts journey to TA]</ref> A page calling for a "Third Palestinian Intifada" to begin on 15 May garnered more than 350,000 "likes" before being taken down by Facebook managers at the end of March after complaints from the Israeli government that the page encouraged violence.<ref name=Philips>[http://www.thirdage.com/news/israeli-troops-clash-with-palestinian-protesters_05-15-2011?page=2 Israeli Troops Clash with Palestinian Protesters]</ref> {{Verify credibility|date=June 2011}} <ref name=CNN3>[http://articles.cnn.com/2011-03-29/world/palestinian.facebook_1_facebook-page-social-media-website-incites-violence?_s=PM:WORLD Facebook page supporting Palestinian intifada pulled down]</ref> The page called for mass marches to Palestine from Egypt, Lebanon, Syria and Jordan to commemorate the Nakba and demand the [[Palestinian right of return|right of return]] for all Palestinian refugees.<ref name=AhramO>[http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/11737/Egypt/Politics-/Egyptians-call-for-a-march-to-Palestine-on-Nakba-d.aspx Egyptians to mark Nakba with a march to Palestine]</ref> Palestinians from Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Syria, the Gaza Strip and the West Bank attempted to reach and cross the Israeli border. However, they were all stopped and 12 were shot and killed by Israeli security forces. Almost 300 people were injured, including 13 Israeli soldiers. There were also clashes across the annexed east Jerusalem.<ref>[http://www.france24.com/en/20110516-bloodshed-along-israel-borders-kills-12-nakba-day-0# Bloodshed along Israel borders kills 12 on Nakba Day]</ref>
